Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a drab-coloured pottery vessel, the fabric contains many small white inclusions, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and faint traces of two lines of black-painted hieratic text, recording the date for delivery of meat to the kitchen.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Prof Walter B Emery
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393752) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393752)
